summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 2020 requesting assistance for a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email indicates the investigation is active and high-profile, with the New York FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad seeking personnel to help review potentially privileged material.

connections.description: SA is requesting assistance from M for personnel to help with a taint review in the Epstein case, indicating a professional working relationship within the FBI.

events.title: Initial Taint Review Request
events.description: An FBI agent sends an email to 'M' requesting assistance with a taint review for the Epstein case.

events.title: Formal Taint Review Assistance Request
events.description: A formal request is forwarded through the FBI chain, identifying the need for assistance from NY Squad C-2 for a taint review in the Jeffrey Epstein case, calling it a 'unique opportunity' on a 'high profile investigation'.

keyFacts: The FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was still active and seeking resources as of June 2020.
The investigation involved a 'taint review', a legal process to separate privileged communications from non-privileged evidence.
The request came from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad, specifically Squad C-2.
The email characterizes working on the Epstein case as a 'unique opportunity' and a 'high profile investigation'.
The document shows internal FBI coordination and resource allocation for a sensitive, ongoing case.
